descr: "Describes the event of a patient consuming or otherwise being administered a medication.  This may be as simple as swallowing a tablet or it may be a long running infusion.  Related resources tie this event to the authorizing prescription, and the specific encounter between patient and health care practitioner."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a MedicationAdministration resource"

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "External identifier - FHIR will generate its own internal identifiers (probably URLs) which do not need to be explicitly managed by the resource.  The identifier here is one that would be used by another non-FHIR system - for example an automated medication pump would provide a record each time it operated; an administration while the patient was off the ward might be made with a different system and entered after the event.  Particularly important if these records have to be updated."

fields.name: definition
fields.descr: "A protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that was adhered to in whole or in part by this event."

fields.name: partOf
fields.descr: "A larger event of which this particular event is a component or step."

fields.name: status
fields.descr: "Will generally be set to show that the administration has been completed.  For some long running administrations such as infusions it is possible for an administration to be started but not completed or it may be paused while some other process is under way."

fields.name: _status
fields.descr: "Extensions for status"

fields.name: category
fields.descr: "Indicates the type of medication administration and where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered."

fields.name: medicationCodeableConcept
fields.descr: "Identifies the medication that was administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications."

fields.name: medicationReference
fields.descr: "Identifies the medication that was administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications."

fields.name: subject
fields.descr: "The person or animal or group receiving the medication."

fields.name: context
fields.descr: "The visit, admission or other contact between patient and health care provider the medication administration was performed as part of."

fields.name: supportingInformation
fields.descr: "Additional information (for example, patient height and weight) that supports the administration of the medication."

fields.name: effectiveDateTime
fields.descr: "A specific date/time or interval of time during which the administration took place (or did not take place, when the 'notGiven' attribute is true). For many administrations, such as swallowing a tablet the use of dateTime is more appropriate."

fields.name: _effectiveDateTime
fields.descr: "Extensions for effectiveDateTime"

fields.name: effectivePeriod
fields.descr: "A specific date/time or interval of time during which the administration took place (or did not take place, when the 'notGiven' attribute is true). For many administrations, such as swallowing a tablet the use of dateTime is more appropriate."

fields.name: performer
fields.descr: "The individual who was responsible for giving the medication to the patient."

fields.name: notGiven
fields.descr: "Set this to true if the record is saying that the medication was NOT administered."

fields.name: _notGiven
fields.descr: "Extensions for notGiven"

fields.name: reasonNotGiven
fields.descr: "A code indicating why the administration was not performed."

fields.name: reasonCode
fields.descr: "A code indicating why the medication was given."

fields.name: reasonReference
fields.descr: "Condition or observation that supports why the medication was administered."

fields.name: prescription
fields.descr: "The original request, instruction or authority to perform the administration."

fields.name: device
fields.descr: "The device used in administering the medication to the patient.  For example, a particular infusion pump."

fields.name: note
fields.descr: "Extra information about the medication administration that is not conveyed by the other attributes."

fields.name: dosage
fields.descr: "Describes the medication dosage information details e.g. dose, rate, site, route, etc."

fields.name: eventHistory
fields.descr: "A summary of the events of interest that have occurred, such as when the administration was verified."
